bill_title: assist fraternities and sororities at South Dakota State University to obtain commercial financing for improvements on land subject to certain reversionary clauses.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to assist fraternities and sororities at South Dakota State University to obtain commercial financing for improvements on land subject to certain reversionary clauses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-58-25 be amended to read as follows: 13-58-25. The Board of Regents is hereby authorized to may convey by sale real property constituting a part of the campus at South Dakota State University at Brookings, South Dakota , on such terms as the board shall deem advisable, to nationally chartered fraternal or sororital organizations or to local fraternal or sororital associations whose purpose in buying such property is to construct a residence for men or women students at South Dakota State University who are members of the fraternal or sororital organization. The authorization granted by this section is subject to the following conditions, which collectively are deemed to be covenants running with the land for purposes of chapters 43-12 and 43-30: (1) Any fraternal or sororital organization that acquires land pursuant to this chapter covenants to enforce such rules as the Board of Regents may prescribe; to insure the property and improvements at their full value, to maintain it in good repair, and to effect such repairs and renovations as may be necessary to preserve the appearance, integrity, utility, and safety of improvements at levels comparable to university operated housing units; to design, to specify, and to construct all improvements, repairs, and renovations in accordance with the requirements stated in § § 5-14-11 to 5-14-13, inclusive; to deliver to the Board of Regents all plans, specifications, and construction documents in the formats that the state engineer requires for the keeping of such records; and to accept such other terms as the Board of Regents may deem advisable; (2) If said the real property ceases to be used as a residence for men or women students at South Dakota State University, then said the real property and any buildings thereon shall revert to the body which conveyed title to said fraternal organization Board of Regents on behalf of the State of South Dakota; (3) A fraternal or sororital organization that acquires property pursuant to this section may pledge its interest in the property as collateral to finance improvement, repair, and renovation projects if the Board of Regents approves the financing. Such approval may not unreasonably be denied by the Board of Regents if the financing arrangements conform to the requirements of this section. However, no pledge may impair the reversionary interest reserved to the State of South Dakota; (4) If at the time that property reverts to the State of South Dakota, in lieu of any right to foreclose upon property pledged to support a financing agreement, any financier has the right to request that the Board of Regents enter into a lease with the financier for the remaining term of the financing agreement to permit the financier to maintain and to operate the facility or site as a student residence, or to sublease the property for such purposes to a sublessee approved by the Board of Regents. The Board of Regents shall grant such request if the financier enters into a written agreement to insure the property and improvements at their full value, to maintain it in good repair, and to effect such renovations as may be necessary to preserve the appearance, integrity, utility, and safety of improvements at levels comparable to university operated housing units. No action undertaken pursuant to this section by any private actor may be or become a lien, charge, or liability against the State of South Dakota, nor against the property or funds of the State of South Dakota within the meaning of the Constitution or statutes of South Dakota; (5) Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the contrary, any instrument of transfer prepared pursuant to this Act is deemed to include express restrictions conforming to this Act .
